JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Georgieva;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON Ilieva and her daughter , PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in PERSON . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicants lived together next door to the first applicant ’s brother , PERSON lived with his wife PERSON and their son PERSON The first applicant ’s mother , an elderly woman , used to live with PERSON , but following a dispute with him moved in with the first applicant and her daughters .

CARDINAL . The first applicant and PERSON had also had a long - running dispute . The move of their mother exacerbated the rift between the neighbours . It appears that their ongoing conflict prompted the police to warn them several times not to harass each other or their families . On various occasions the applicants and PERSON lodged actions and complaints with the competent authorities , alleging harassment and unlawful conduct .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant and her other daughter argued with PERSON over the presence of a brick wall between the QUANTITY . The tension escalated and someone called the police . There is contradictory information regarding the incident but , in any event , the police officers warned ORG not to physically or psychologically harass the applicants .

CARDINAL . At TIME DATE , DATE , the applicants , the first applicant ’s other daughter and CARDINAL grandchildren , who were minors , were walking past ORG house , heading towards the children ’s school . The first applicant ’s mother was standing at the front door of their house .

CARDINAL . There is conflicting evidence about the events which followed . During the ensuing investigation , the applicants claimed that when PERSON noticed them walking down the street , he started throwing stones at them . According to the applicants he was still feeling angry about the incident of DATE . Despite the provocation , the applicants simply told him to stop and continued walking . According to the applicants , PERSON and PERSON took advantage of the fact that the applicants were leaving and started verbally abusing PERSON ’s mother . The latter began calling for help .

CARDINAL . G.M. and PERSON contested this account of the events and maintained that the argument had started when , while having their TIME coffee , they heard the mother murmuring obscenities at ORG and were drawn into an argument with her . In their view , at that point the elderly woman started complaining loudly of harassment .

CARDINAL . It appears that when they heard the elderly woman ’s cries , the first applicant and her daughters rushed back and engaged in a physical fight with PERSON got involved and started hitting the applicants , according to them with something resembling a hoe . The first applicant allegedly started exerting pressure on his testicles . Having heard the commotion , PERSON ran out of the house and joined in the fight , hitting the applicants with a stick . In their statements during the investigation the applicants claimed that PERSON , PERSON and PERSON also shouted obscenities at them .

CARDINAL . The fight apparently did not last a long time . Shortly after it was over the applicants made a complaint at the police station and visited a doctor . The doctor noted in his report that the first applicant had sustained the following injuries : a wound of CARDINAL by CARDINAL PERSON with uneven sores around the edges on the left side of the back of her head ; swelling , a bruise and a small wound of CARDINAL by PERSON in the left corner of her mouth ; a bruise of CARDINAL PERSON on the back of her left forearm ; a welt across the buttocks of CARDINAL by QUANTITY ; and abrasions on both knees . The second applicant had swelling and a bruise of CARDINAL by QUANTITY with a ruptured mucous membrane on the inside of her left cheek .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a complaint with the GPE district prosecutor . On DATE the police warned GPE , PERSON and PERSON , in writing , not to physically and psychologically harass the applicants .

CARDINAL . It appears from the applicants’ submissions that by a decree of an unspecified date the district prosecutor refused to open criminal proceedings on the ground that the actions complained of constituted minor bodily harm and proceedings were to be taken on the basis of a private criminal complaint lodged with the court .
CARDINAL . Following that , on DATE the applicants brought a private criminal complaint before ORG against GPE , PERSON and LAW for inflicting minor bodily harm and insulting them in public .
CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the court accepted for examination the applicants’ civil claims together with their private criminal complaint .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the court held several hearings and heard a number of witnesses .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE the court discontinued the proceedings and transferred the case to the prosecutor on the ground that the actions complained of constituted hooliganism , a crime which was subject to public prosecution . The parties did not appeal against the decision .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor examined the case file in the light of the court ’s findings that the legal characterisation of the offence was hooliganism . By a decree of DATE he refused to open criminal proceedings against ORG , PERSON and PERSON , stating once again that the criminal characterisation of the actions complained of was minor bodily harm , to be prosecuted by means of a private criminal complaint .

CARDINAL . The applicants learned about the prosecutor ’s decree of DATE on an unspecified date . It appears that the first applicant ’s appeal against the decree resulted in the case being remitted to the district prosecutor with instructions . However , the applicants failed to submit any information about the reasons for the remittal or about any subsequent actions of the district prosecutor .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , the prosecutor sent his decree of DATE to ORG . By a judicial order of CARDINAL DATE the judge rapporteur who had previously been in charge of the case withdrew and , on DATE , another judge was appointed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing but decided to discontinue the examination of the case against GPE , PERSON and PERSON , noting that the court ’s decision of DATE had become final and put an end to the criminal proceedings against GPE , PERSON and PERSON The court further noted that in view of the discontinuance of the proceedings by a final act , the steps undertaken by the court , namely the withdrawal of the previous judge rapporteur and the appointment of a new one , were irrelevant . In view of this , it also stated that its findings were not subject to appeal .

CARDINAL . Nevertheless , the applicants challenged the court ’s decision . In a decision of DATE ORG upheld ORG findings , in particular its conclusion that the court ’s decision of DATE had put an end to the criminal proceedings against ORG , PERSON and PERSON

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , but apparently before DATE , the first applicant sent another complaint concerning the same matter to ORG , which transferred it to the district prosecutor . On DATE , the district prosecutor refused to open criminal proceedings . The prosecutor stated that at the time the applicants submitted their complaint to ORG , criminal proceedings had been pending before ORG on the same facts , which prevented the institution of criminal proceedings by a public prosecutor . It appears that the decree became final shortly thereafter .
